title: The World Is Getting Warmer. Fashion Thinks it Can Handle the Heat.
summary: Weather extremes like the sizzling heatwaves that blanketed Europe and the US this week pose a growing threat to business. But in recently released investor reports, big fashion brands say they don’t see climate as a material risk in the near term.

summary: Unlike typical IP battles, Lululemon’s dispute with Costco is playing out in the court of public opinion — where consumers increasingly favour dupes over pricey originals.

title: H&M Releases First Images With AI Digital Twins
summary: The company debuted the images on Instagram on Wednesday, in a post that explained its approach to AI imagery.

title: The Fashion Revival of Basketball Sneakers
summary: A wave of new performance basketball sneakers featuring fresh designs has shoppers once again considering the category for fashion and not just for wear on the court.

summary: Join us for a BoF Professional Masterclass that explores the topic in “The State of Fashion: Beauty Volume 2.”

summary: Sunscreen is the latest product to attract consumer ire, with numerous brands releasing so-called ‘universal’ offerings that, in practice, often don’t work on darker skin tones. Fixing formulations, however, isn’t easy.

summary: Brands are making golf fashionable for women through unexpected collaborations and creator content that flips the sport’s once elitist connotation on its head.

summary: While the yen’s plummet drove a rush of international shoppers looking for bargains, Japan’s famously robust secondhand fashion market is set to keep growing even as the currency bounces back.

title: Japan’s Department Store Shares Lag as Tourist Splurge Slows
summary: Low confidence stemming from economic uncertainty has crimped tourist budgets with data compiled by the Japan Department Stores Association showing tax-free inbound sales at over 80 department stores across the country fell by 41 percent in May from a year earlier.

summary: Join us for a BoF Professional Masterclass that explores the topic in our latest Case Study, “How Brands Build Genuine Communities.”

title: France Fines Retailer Shein €40 Million for Misleading Discounts
summary: Fast-fashion retailer Shein has been fined €40 million for deceptive business practices, after a nearly year-long investigation found that a significant percentage of advertised deals were not genuine.

summary: Though the ceremony sparked ire online, it generated significant media impact value for the brands involved.

title: Reliance Retail Invests in Facial Chain Facegym
summary: The partnership will bring Facegym’s signature treatments to the Indian market through both standalone studios and spaces within its Tira beauty stores.

title: Will Anyone Buy the ‘Exosome’ Hype?
summary: Another day, another teeny molecule from a Korean spa. Have we hit peak ‘innovation’?

title: Watches of Switzerland Warns US Tariffs to Weigh on Margin
summary: The UK-based luxury watch retailer said its margin on earnings before interest and taxes risks slipping by as much as 100 basis points compared with the previous 12 months.

title: Why Blum’s Closure Is Shaking the Art World
summary: Major gallerist Tim Blum’s decision to exit the business will shake the art sector, writes Marc Spiegler.

title: After Prada ‘Sandal Scandal,’ Indian Sellers Tap Nationalist Pride to Boost Sales
summary: Sales are surging for the 'Kolhapuri' sandals that garnered global attention after Prada sparked a controversy by showing a similar design on the runway without crediting its origin.

title: Trump Announces Vietnam Trade Deal With 20% Import Tariff
summary: President Donald Trump said he had reached a trade deal with Vietnam following weeks of intense diplomacy between the nations and ahead of a deadline next week that would have seen higher tariffs imposed on the country’s imports.

title: The Executive Briefing: Iran, C-Suite Shakeups and the AI Ad Revolution
summary: Last month, the fashion industry was jolted by rising geopolitical tensions, unexpected boardroom moves, and more. Read on for your concise breakdown of June’s key developments from executive editor Brian Baskin.

title: Why So Many Beauty Founders Are Morphing Into Gurus
summary: A crop of successful founders are finding their beauty business may not be enough to keep them occupied. Many are taking their life learnings and dispensing them to the public — through books, on-demand talks and accelerator programs — for a price.

title: Nike’s Jordan Brand to Open First Flagship in Milan
summary: Nike’s Jordan brand, created in collaboration with NBA All-Star Michael Jordan, is set to open its first dedicated retail flagship in Milan later this month.

title: The Technology Behind On’s Newest ‘Super Shoe’
summary: The Swiss brand’s athletes have already been winning races using its new technology, LightSpray, which forms the basis of its latest racing sneaker, the $330 Cloudboom Strike LS.

title: Has Supreme Hit a Ceiling?
summary: Sales at the VF Corp.-owned brand have slipped, a sign that there may be a limit to how much its pioneering drops and collabs model can scale. But don’t count the streetwear giant out yet.

summary: Forget your $285 Nike Alphaflys and that $150 Salomon technical vest. The biggest flex is turning up to run club with a perfect recovery score on Oura or Whoop.

title: Mielle Organics Becomes WNBA’s First Textured Hair Care Partner
summary: Mielle Organics is set to begin a groundbreaking partnership with the WNBA as the elite US women’s basketball league’s first textured hair care partner, the brand said in a statement Thursday.

summary: Salomon chief executive Franco Fogliato will depart the brand effective immediately due to personal reasons, parent company Amer Sports said Friday.

title: Highsnobiety Launches New Sports Vertical With Concept Store
summary: The streetwear and luxury media publisher is expanding its coverage to include a new vertical about the role of sports in fashion and culture.

summary: Fast-growing start-ups like Hettas, Saysh and Moolah Kicks created sneakers designed specifically for active women. The sportswear giants are watching closely.

title: Streetwear Enters Formula 1 With Palm Angels Collaboration
summary: The Italian streetwear label is the latest brand to seek to take advantage of the motorsport’s widening appeal, partnering with American team Haas F1.

title: At Pitti and Milan Men’s, It’s Gorpcore vs. Quiet Luxury
summary: A host of buzzy emerging designers will bring the hipster-meets-hiking trend to Italy, while heritage labels are riding high on the craze for pricey, muted style. That, plus what else to watch for this week.

title: Louis Vuitton Extends Nicolas Ghesquière’s Contract
summary: Louis Vuitton has renewed the contract of its womenswear artistic director Nicolas Ghesquière for another five years, the French luxury house said in a release Tuesday.

title: The Debrief | Why Some Sports Win Big in Fashion — and Others Don’t
summary: Senior correspondent Sheena Butler-Young and executive editor Brian Baskin are joined by BoF sports correspondent Daniel-Yaw Miller to examine how luxury brands are tapping into the world of sports, from football and Formula 1 to women’s basketball.

title: Puma Hires A$AP Rocky as Creative Director of Formula 1 Partnership
summary: The acclaimed rapper and frequent fashion collaborator will design a capsule collection to be released at the Las Vegas Grand Prix in November. In future seasons, he will have wider creative control over the brand’s multi-year licensing deal with F1.

title: Has Fashion’s Convergence With Sports Gone Too Far?
summary: The deluge of sports-inspired product releases and collaborations between brands and sports teams or athletes has saturated the market and started to spur a backlash. But insiders say there is still room for tie-ups which go beyond simple logo swaps or licensing deals.

title: Reebok Names New Head of Basketball
summary: Designer Jide Osifeso will shape the creative direction of Reebok Basketball as the brand seeks to re-establish itself in a performance category it’s been absent from for more than a decade.

title: Coach Is the WNBA’s First Official Handbag Partner
summary: The multi-year partnership is the latest collaboration in the growing intersection of fashion and sports.

title: The NFL Makes a Play for Women’s Fashion
summary: After a Taylor Swift-related surge in viewership and buzz last season, the NFL is partnering with New York-based Veronica Beard to capitalise on the fashion opportunity.

title: How Fashion Can Nail the Tricky Details of Sports Partnerships
summary: As fashion’s interest in sports grows, brands are getting a crash course in the complicated world of sports sponsorships.

title: New Balance Bets Its Basketball Future on Cooper Flagg
summary: The brand known for its running shoes is making its mark in the basketball business after signing 18-year-old NBA Draft top pick Cooper Flagg.

title: How the WNBA Tunnel Walk Became a Fashion Marketing Gold Mine
summary: Superstar rookies-turned-pre-game models like Angel Reese and Cameron Brink have transformed the league’s tunnel walk into the hottest runway in town, with brands like Balmain, Prada and Versace clamouring to cash in on the league’s newfound fashion appeal.

title: African Sneaker Brands Go Global
summary: Big hitters and scrappy start-ups in Kenya, Nigeria, Senegal and South Africa are vying for a share of the $152 billion global sneaker market.

title: Luxury Resale Platform Cudoni Shuts Down
summary: The London-based start-up said the current economic climate had made it “impossible” to continue doing business.

title: How Sports Partnerships Are Making Fashion’s Waste Problem Worse
summary: Sportswear giants like Nike and Adidas churn out mountains of apparel and equipment for their sponsored teams each season, the bulk of which ends up in the trash. Now, start-ups and designers are trying to reduce waste by upcycling this unused merch.

title: Inditex Shutters Bershka, Pull & Bear and Stradivarius Businesses in China
summary: The Spanish retail giant will end the e-commerce operations of the three brands in China this month.

title: Fashion’s Sports Obsession Is No Accident
summary: The Olympics are proving a perfect marriage of the sports and fashion industries. It’s the culmination of several factors that have turned sport into fashion’s most exciting new arena over the past two years.

title: Inside Fashion’s Biggest Olympics Ever
summary: Long the marketing domain of sportswear giants, the 2024 Olympic games in Paris are seeing an influx of fashion advertisers who are getting creative in how they capitalise on one of the few remaining events with massive global impact.

title: Do Sports Leagues Need ‘Creative Directors’?
summary: Major League Soccer tapped streetwear designer Guillermo Andrade to be its creative advisor, hoping his cultural cachet will make the sport more popular in the US.

title: Why Salomon-Owner Amer Sports’ IPO Fell Short
summary: After discounting its listing, the sportswear group, which also owns Arc’teryx and Wilson, became the latest big fashion company to confront the tepid US IPO market.

title: Indie Brands Are Making This Fashion’s Biggest Olympics Ever
summary: Canada, France and Ireland are among the countries working with home-grown fashion talent to create uniforms for their teams at this summer’s Olympic Games. For these small labels, it’s an unprecedented opportunity to capitalise on one of sports’ largest events.

title: Here Comes the Gorpcore Backlash

title: Adidas’ Plans for Yeezy: What We Know
summary: The German sportswear giant hinted it could try to sell already produced sneakers from the collaboration, but predicted its first annual loss in over three decades.

title: Kim Kardashian’s Skims Hires First Chief Commercial Officer
summary: The shapewear, intimates and loungewear label has recruited Robert Norton, formerly president of Moncler Americas, to the newly created role, the company confirmed in a LinkedIn post Monday.

title: The Debrief | Is Luxury’s Streetwear Obsession Over?
summary: BoF’s Daniel-Yaw Miller discusses streetwear’s evolution from subculture to high fashion favourite — and whether the aesthetic’s waning influence spells its end.

title: Lewis Hamilton Named Dior Ambassador
summary: The seven-time Formula 1 champion has guest-designed a collection set to launch in October.

title: A Memo to Elliott Hill on His First Day at Nike
summary: The new CEO has a monumental task ahead of him as he begins work on Nike’s turnaround strategy.  Success means resetting expectations, showing evidence of meaningful innovation, recapturing the attention of sneakerheads and earning the trust of retailers.

title: Supreme’s Sale to EssilorLuxottica, Explained
summary: North Face owner VF Corp is selling the streetwear juggernaut to the Italian eyewear giant for $1.5 billion in cash. BoF breaks down the deal.

title: How Athletes Went From Selling Merch to Building Fashion Brands
summary: High-profile athletes used to make money by inking licensing deals with retailers that use their names on jerseys and shorts. Today, sports stars like Russell Westbrook and Megan Rapinoe are launching their own labels, with full financial and creative control.

title: Asics Launches ‘Anti-Gorpcore’ Clothing Line With Kiko Kostadinov
summary: The Japanese sportswear giant has created a new unisex clothing line called Novalis alongside long-time collaborator Kiko Kostadinov. The sub-brand will be stocked at retailers like Dover Street Market.

title: What a Winning Strategy Looks Like in Today’s Sneaker Market
summary: Nike and On are dominating the sneaker category today thanks to their focus on performance-driven products and discipline in their direct channels.

title: Hugo Boss’ Hugo Brand to Sponsor VCARB F1 Team
summary: The German retailer’s Gen-Z label will design apparel and eyewear for the newly rebranded Visa Cash App RB team.

title: Mowalola, Fashion’s Subversive Rising Star, Debuts in Paris
summary: In just six years since graduating from Central Saint Martins, the Nigerian-British creative has attracted deals with Yeezy, New Balance and Dover Street Market for her transgressive “burglarwear” aesthetic. Now, she’s getting ready to reintroduce her label on fashion’s biggest stage.

title: Menswear’s New Groove: Casual Suiting Meets Gorpcore?
summary: Established luxury brands, emerging designers and buzzy technical players alike mixed relaxed suiting with sportswear at the influential Pitti Uomo trade show.

title: Where Does Nike Go From Here?
summary: With pressure mounting on CEO John Donahoe, the sportswear giant’s precise turnaround plan remains unclear. But the rehiring of Nike veteran Tom Peddie this week offered more clues on the brand’s direction.

title: FIFA to Launch Fashion Line in Partnership with VFiles
summary: Football’s global governing body is set to launch its inaugural ‘FIFA 1904′ collection in spring 2025.

title: Nike’s Latest Sports Headache, Explained
summary: FC Barcelona may take its on-field kit and fan merchandise in-house after falling out with Nike. Football industry executives and rival sportswear brands will be watching its next moves closely.

title: The Football Team That Finally Got Fashion Right
summary: Vogue-produced campaigns, streetwear tie-ups, fashion week events and special relationships with Off-White and Puma have helped Italian giant AC Milan infiltrate the industry where other teams have fallen short.

title: Inside China’s Burgeoning Streetwear Scene
summary: The country's streetwear market is heating up, attracting both global consumers and major brand collaborations.

title: Tomorrow Ltd Acquires Samuel Ross’ A-Cold-Wall
summary: After buying out the designer’s stake, the London-based brand accelerator now owns 100 percent of the label.

title: Dao-Yi Chow Appointed Creative Director of New Era
summary: The former Public School and DKNY designer will launch the cap brand’s first apparel line.

title: The Debrief | Fashion Tech Boom 2.0
summary: Investor interest in fashion tech is back, but this time, is it more substance than style? Malique Morris joins The Debrief to discuss how startups with real technical expertise and practical AI tools are leading a new wave of innovation.

title: Giorgio Armani Posts 24% Profit Drop in Tough 2024, Steps Up Investments
summary: The Milanese group was hit by declining revenues and a slight increase in operating costs but said it retained a long-term approach amid a sharp downturn in luxury demand.

title: Can Adidas Move On From Yeezy?
summary: Top of incoming CEO Bjørn Gulden’s in-tray will be dealing with unsold Yeezy inventory and reversing the brand’s steep decline in China.

title: Fast Fashion’s M&A Frenzy, Explained
summary: Amid a spending slowdown and steep competition, the UK fast-fashion players including Asos and Frasers Group are selling off struggling brands.

title: How Marathons Became Fashion Shows
summary: This year’s New York City Marathon will witness an unprecedented slew of fashion-related activations like branded run clubs, sneaker drops and even a beauty sponsorship as the industry goes all in on running culture.

title: Burberry Announces Korean Footballer Son Heung-min as Ambassador
summary: The British fashion house is the latest luxury brand to partner with a footballer after Gucci tapped Jack Grealish in May and Dior hired Kylian Mbappé.

title: How Hoka Fends Off the Imitators
summary: The brand’s quirky running sneakers are no longer a novelty as rivals like Nike, Adidas and On launch similar styles. Yet sales continue to soar as consumers embrace its winning formula of comfort, versatility and unconventional looks.

title: How Athletes Became Fashion Week Royalty
summary: It’s not just sports superstars sitting front row at fashion week. Today, luxury labels are looking to work with emerging athletes from niche sports, giving rise to new dealmakers who match brands with eager skateboarders, boxers and rugby players.

title: How Fashion Entered the Formula One Race
summary: A new owner, media-friendly strategy and an upcoming Brad Pitt film have helped catapult Formula One into the cultural spotlight. For brands, there are untapped opportunities in the sport – “like a Super Bowl every weekend”.

title: How Adidas Is Introducing a New Generation to Its Oldest Sneakers
summary: The sportswear giant’s lifestyle and fashion division is set to release a new campaign and “visual identity” to emphasise the cultural cachet of its Samba, Gazelle and Superstar sneaker franchises.

title: Amazon Launches ‘Luxury Stores’ Platform in Europe
summary: The e-commerce giant’s luxury fashion vertical, first introduced in the US in September 2020, is now available in the UK, Germany, France, Italy and Spain.

title: Cargo Pants Are Back, But Not the Ones Your Dad Wore
summary: Celebrities and TikTok influencers have dusted off another half-forgotten trend. What started as a rebellion against skinny jeans is taking some odd turns.

title: Priya Ahluwalia on Changing the Fashion Narrative
summary: The London-based designer has won recognition for her vibrant designs patched together from vintage clothes. Now she wants to grow her business without sacrificing its core values.

title: Why Padel Is Luxury’s New Favourite Sport
summary: Brands from Valentino to Prada and start-ups like Pulco Studios are vying to cash in on the racket sport’s aspirational aesthetic and affluent fanbase.

title: Athletes Don’t Want Nike or Adidas Anymore. They Want Independence.
summary: Young stars increasingly favour deals with lesser known brands that align with their personal values and allow them to play a bigger role, creatively and commercially.

title: Adidas to Launch Fear of God Athletics Collaboration in Second Half of 2023
summary: Chief executive Bjorn Gulden confirmed the release date of the long-awaited tie-up on an earnings call with media Friday morning.

title: Off-Price Retailer Brand Alley Has Acquired The Edit Ldn, a Sneaker Resale Platform
summary: The sale comes after the sneaker platform, which recently attracted investment from several athletes, experienced cash flow issues towards the end of last year.

title: Highsnobiety’s New Store That Isn’t a Store
summary: At least not in the traditional sense. A soon-to-launch Berlin flagship will sell stuff, but it’s brand partnerships that are expected to make the company’s latest retail experiment work.

title: Fast-Fashion Giant Shein Plans $2.3 Billion Supply Chain Hub
summary: The Chinese fast-fashion retailer plans to invest 15 billion yuan ($2.3 billion) to build a global supply chain centre in Guangzhou.

title: What’s Driving the Men’s Jewellery Boom?
summary: Menswear has a hot new category: signet rings, beaded bracelets and silver chains — a trend driven by shifting gender norms and the overall casualisation of fashion.

title: Inside New Balance’s Plan to Become a $10 Billion Sportswear Giant
summary: In under a decade, the Boston-based company transformed itself from a brand for dads and runners into one of the hottest players in the sneaker world. Now, it’s using the Olympics and an expanding roster of collaborators, athlete partners and sports categories as catalysts to achieve its lofty ambitions.

title: The Future of Airport Retail
summary: Travellers returning to the airport for the first time since the pandemic will find a different retail landscape awaits them past the security gate.

title: Salomon’s Super Bowl Surprise
summary: Rihanna wore Salomon’s “Cross Low” sneakers as part of her all-red ensemble during the halftime performance, marking the culmination of the brand’s recent rise in fashion.

title: ‘Sportstyle’ Footwear Is Taking Over the Sneaker Resale Market
summary: Brands like Asics, Hoka and Salomon have by some measures elbowed out basketball shoes as the secondhand market’s hottest sneakers.

title: The Debate Over Nike’s CEO Bursts Into the Open
summary: Speculation about the chief executive’s future is now happening in the open public as pressure grows on Nike's management to enact a turnaround — and do it sooner than later.

title: Can Nike Turn the Forgotten Jordan 2 Into the Next Hype Sneaker?
summary: With the Dunk past its prime, Nike is looking for its next hype sneaker. It’s banking on the AJ2, the forgotten child of the Jordan family.

title: A New Era of Fashion-Carmaker Collaborations
summary: From Rimowa’s new tie-up with Porsche to Mercedes teaming up with Palace, a new wave of fashion-carmaker partnerships is targeting a younger generation of aspirational consumers.

title: Inside the Big Business of Styling Athletes
summary: NBA stars and footballers are increasingly leaning on a network of powerful style consultants to help them shape their personal brands away from their day jobs, laying the groundwork for lucrative brand deals.

title: Motorsport Needs More Women, Says Racer and Elemis Ambassador Jessica Hawkins
summary: “We need to inspire a younger generation," said Hawkins, head of the F1 Academy, and the new Elemis brand ambassador, during a talk in London.

title: Kate Moss’ Beauty Brand Cosmoss Enters Liquidation Proceedings After Three Years
summary: Moss launched her brand in September 2022, debuting six products across wellness and skin care.

title: Dsm-firmenich Names Jonathan Simon President of Fine Fragrance
summary: The executive succeeds Jerry Vittoria, who led the division since 2017 and was with the supplier for 35 years.

title: EXCLUSIVE: Jimmy Fairly Cofounder Launches Beauty Brand Firn
summary: Sacha Bostoni is starting with skin care but will branch into other categories and open freestanding stores by year-end.

title: Inside the Challenges Befalling Black-owned Brands in 2025 — and How They’re Facing Them
summary: Black founders and executives weigh in on how M&A slowdowns and diversity, equity and inclusion rollbacks are challenging their businesses.

title: Is the Labubu Effect Coming for Beauty Next?
summary: The Pop Mart-made dolls have seen a surge in popularity across the globe, spurring collaborations with brands from Sacai to Coca-Cola.

title: With WhatsApp Partnership, L’Oréal Paris Wants People to Ask Beauty Genius — Not ChatGPT — for Beauty Help
summary: After soft-launching the generative AI-powered beauty advice and education tool in October, L'Oréal Paris is gearing up to go wider with Beauty Genius.

title: How Much Beauty’s 10 Biggest Brands on TikTok Shop Made in May — From Tarte to Maybelline
summary: A breakdown of the top 10 beauty brands by TikTok Shop sales during the month of May, per Charm.io, plus their respective top-selling products.

title: L’Oréal Acquires Color Wow
summary: The hair care brand started by serial entrepreneur Gail Federici will live in the Professional Products Division.

title: MAC Cosmetics Debuts ‘Musical Spaceship’ Concept for Nanjing Flagship
summary: Designed by the Chinese architect Li Xiang of X+Living, the centerpiece of the space is a deconstructed piano that doubles as merchandise display.

title: Glossy Pop Newsletter: When it comes to brand trips, is all press good press?
summary: Over the weekend, TikTok was flooded with posts of major influencers partying in Tulum with the electrolytes brand Waterboy. At the same time, dozens of posts criticizing the brand’s social media strategy for the trip began circulating: Why weren't the influencers showing the products? And don't electrolytes help thwart hangovers? Why, then, were they posting about how hungover they were? The marketing experts on TikTok (read: everyone) had questions.

title: How much does the social media backlash to the Sánchez-Bezos wedding matter to brands?
summary: The polarizing reactions to the wedding beg the question: Is dressing the woman marrying the fourth-richest man in the world worth the backlash that seems inevitable with any obscene displays of wealth? For the luxury brands involved, the answer seems to be yes.

title: ‘I can have my cake and eat it, too’: Why younger patients are seeking facelifts
summary: Facelifts have had a makeover. Once synonymous with the overdone plastic surgery look of pinched skin and taut ears, today’s facelifts have a new look thanks to advancing techniques and open conversations around cosmetic procedures. And doctors say they are now seeing more patients in their 40s and 50s seeking out the procedure.

title: Fashion Briefing: The soccer opportunity for fashion is booming in the US
summary: It's a good time for American brands to get in on the action, as several major soccer tournaments are set to take place in the U.S. over the next few years.

title: Vogue faces new headwinds as Anna Wintour — who agency execs say made ad dollars flow — shifts focus
summary: Anna Wintour's successor at Vogue will have to overcome the myriad of challenges facing fashion media and the digital publishing ecosystem.

title: Luxury Briefing: As Wimbledon kicks off, tenniscore gets a fashion-forward update
summary: In this week's luxury briefing, we dive into how luxury fashion is approaching a post-"Challengers" tennis fashion landscape at Wimbledon and beyond. Also, why casualization is happening in men's fashion, what products luxury customers are actually buying, executive moves, the latest Glossy Podcast and news to know.

title: With Dedcool, Erewhon launches its first fragrance-inspired smoothie
summary: With the launch of a limited-edition vegan smoothie, Dedcool's Xtra Milk perfume is the latest product to get the coveted Erewhon smoothie treatment.

title: The fractional factor: The Board’s April Uchitel is helping redefine executive talent strategy
summary: When April Uchitel’s recent LinkedIn post about fractional talent exploded with nearly 1,300 likes, she knew it had struck a nerve. The post didn't just go viral — it was prophetic, serving as a manifesto of sorts for a work revolution Uchitel has helped drive in her role as CEO and cofounder of The Board.

title: How Estée Lauder-owned Aveda leveraged its hairdresser community to create, test and launch its newest hero product
summary: Hair-care brand Aveda is betting big on its newest launch thanks to help from its community of hair pros. Glossy sat down with ELC exec Shane Wolf to learn about Monday's launch of its Miraculous Oil High-Shine Hair Concentrate.

title: Beauty & Wellness Briefing: What’s up with beauty’s executive musical chairs?
summary: Why have so many beauty executives changed roles this year? This week, I checked in with esteemed executive recruiters and industry experts to unpack the many executive hirings and departures happening across the beauty industry. Additionally, Unilever and L’Oréal Group make splashy acquisitions, Ulta Beauty’s CFO suddenly departs, and Neutrogena owner Kenvue plans for dozens of corporate layoffs.

title: Exclusive: Versed lands at Ulta Beauty, backed by its biggest influencer push yet
summary: Six years after its debut, Versed, the affordable beauty brand launched by Katherine Power, is launching at 300 Ulta Beauty doors on July 7. It is available on Ultabeauty.com as of July 1. The move comes on the heels of the brand's introduction of color cosmetics in February, when it introduced a makeup collection with 14 new products at Target, which, apart from its DTC site, has been its sole retailer.

title: Can the body mist category grow up?
summary: Many new body-mist launches are explicitly targeting the lucrative Gen-Z and Gen-Alpha fragrance consumer. But with the category growing more crowded, others are experimenting with body mists featuring sophisticated scents, high-touch packaging, and additional skin and hair benefits to stand out as more than just an appeal to wallet-conscious teens and tweens.

title: Glossy Pop Newsletter: Sabrina Carpenter’s music videos are the new billboard for beauty brands
summary: Music videos are the hot new place for beauty and fashion brands to show up. In Sabrina Carpenter and Addison Rae videos, brands like Prada Beauty, Supergoop and Free People are making the most of the opportunity.

title: ‘Counting likes is no longer enough’: Beauty brands rethink strategy as a wellness focus becomes business-critical
summary: At a Glossy, CEW and Launchmetrics panel in London this week, beauty leaders gathered to discuss how the rise of wellness is reshaping brand strategy in the saturated, fast-moving world of beauty.

title: Glossy Podcast: NBA Draft fashion, Skims x Cavalli and LVMH’s flip-flops — plus,  Lisa Yamner Green on the launch of Daydream
summary: This week on the Glossy Podcast: NBA Draft fashion goes luxury, Skims taps the Cavalli archive, men’s flip flops hit the runway and Daydream’s Lisa Yamner Green shares how AI is reshaping fashion discovery.

title: How Skinfix turned a reformulation flop into a rebranding and community-building opportunity
summary: When Skinfix’s exec team reformulated its hero Triple Lipid-Peptide Cream last year, it didn’t expect an outpouring of frustration from its most loyal shoppers. But instead of doubling down on the "new and improved formula," the brand used the misstep as an opportunity to connect with its community and bring back the original cream alongside a full rebrand. Glossy sat down with CEO Stuart Leitch to learn more.

title: Fashion Briefing: How brands from IWC to Pacsun are hitching a ride on Formula 1’s explosive growth
summary: It’s no coincidence that there are more fashion collaborations with Formula 1 than ever before. With products from licensed T-shirts selling for $35 all the way up to one-of-a-kind Formula 1-inspired watches selling for over $1 million, fashion brands have continued to latch onto the sport’s growing popularity.

title: Unilever’s new acquisition, Glossier’s CEO shakeup — plus, Arrae’s Siff Haider on forecasting wellness trends before they hit big
summary: In the big wide world of health and wellness, there is always a buzzword du jour. In the past couple months, you've likely heard buzz about gut health and GLP-1s, ingredients like creatine and colostrum, and, of course, protein. For many of these trends, Arrae, the supplement brand co-founded by Siffat "Siff" Haider and her husband, Nishant Samantray, has been right there, answering consumer demand with a product featuring that of-the-moment ingredient or speaking to a top-of-mind concern.
